snippet: A Chinese man who carried out an arson attack on a Japanese war shrine will not be deported from Korea to Japan, a South Korean court ruled on Thursday.
abstract: South Korean court sides with China in fight between Beijing and Tokyo for custody of Liu Qiang, Chinese man accused of arson attack at Yasukuni Shrine for Japan's war dead in Tokyo; both cities filed competing requests for Liu's extradition while he was serving 10-month prison sentence in South Korea for separate attack on Japanese embassy there.
lead_paragraph: A Chinese man who carried out an arson attack on a Japanese war shrine will not be deported from Korea to Japan, a South Korean court ruled on Thursday.

headline.seo: South Korean Court Rejects Extradition in Attack on Japanese War Shrine
headline.main: South Korea Rejects Extradition in Attack on Japanese Shrine
headline.print_headline: South Korean Court Rejects Extradition in Attack on Shrine
